intro: Parathesis agostiniana, commonly known as the Agostini's parathesis, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and requires a cool, humid environment to thrive. It is known for its limited distribution and is considered endangered due to habitat loss and climate change. Due to its rarity, it is often studied for its potential ecological and medicinal significance.
